intro: Allantodia, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. The plant has heart-shaped, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Allantodia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
